intro: Cyclobalanopsis paucilamellosa, commonly known as the few-ribbed evergreen oak, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fagaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. It produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the Fagaceae family. This tree is often found in lowland and hill forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
